snippet: Dr. Ian Crozier, who survived an Ebola infection last fall, calls himself a poster child for “post-Ebola syndrome,” which is also being reported in West Africa.
abstract: Dr Ian Crozier, who survived Ebola infection at Emory University Hospital in fall 2014, was found to have virus settled in his left eye; near blindness and pain sent him to seek treatment but location of virus within eye, rather than in its fluids, meant he posed no risk to anyone; anti-viral drug successfully killed his Ebola; Crozier is returning to West Africa to help others there who have reported similar problems with so-called post-Ebola syndrome
lead_paragraph: Dr. Ian Crozier, who survived an Ebola infection last fall, calls himself a poster child for “post-Ebola syndrome,” which is also being reported in West Africa.

headline.main: After Nearly Claiming His Life, Ebola Lurked in a Doctor’s Eye
